alert.note: Alert for Central Interior Cumberland; Coastal Cumberland; Coastal York; Interior York (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 14 at 3:49PM EDT until March 15 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT WINTER STORM CONTINUES INTO WEDNESDAY... .Strengthening low pressure remains in the Gulf of Maine into tomorrow with snow continuing the remainder of today and into tonight. Greatest snowfall will likely fall at higher terrain across the Monadnocks, Sunapee, the Ossippees, and White Mountains. At lower elevations, heavy and wet snow is expected, likely causing additional scattered power outages. Gusty northeast to north winds of 40 to 55 mph this afternoon and evening could accentuate the power outage risk. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations between 3 and 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Maine. Portions of central, northern, and southern New Hampshire. * WHEN...Until Noon EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Heavy wet snow will cause weighted tree limbs of conifers and leafed trees, leading to snapped branches and downed trees. Widespread to numerous power outages possible. The combination of heavy wet snow and gusty winds will lead to snapped branches and a few downed trees. Widespread to numerous power outages likely. Periods of moderate and heavy snow will combine with low visibility to create dangerous driving conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday evening and Wednesday morning commutes. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org Persons should consider delaying all travel. Motorists should use extreme caution if travel is absolutely necessary.
